thread.title: Letter explodes at International Monetary Fund offices in Paris
thread.title_full: Letter explodes at International Monetary Fund offices in Paris

author: Agencies in Paris
title: Letter explodes at International Monetary Fund offices in Paris
text:
Paris Letter explodes at International Monetary Fund offices in Paris 
Police say one person slightly injured but no other damage reported after letter was opened at address in the city Police outside the International Monetary Fund offices in Paris where an envelope exploded. REUTERS/Philippe Wojazer Photograph: Philippe Wojazer/Reuters View more sharing options Thursday 16 March 2017 11.48 GMT Last modified on Thursday 16 March 2017 12.00 GMT 
A letter exploded when it was opened at the International Monetary Fund offices in central Paris , slightly injuring one person, a police source has said. 
A police official said no other damage was reported following the incident on Thursday. It is unclear who sent the letter. The official said police experts were at the scene. 
The IMF office did not immediately respond to calls. 
France remains in a state of emergency after a string of deadly Islamic extremist attacks over the past two years. 
Reuters and Associated Press contributed to this report Topics
